glsa.title: GnuPG: Integer overflow vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: GnuPG is vulnerable to an integer overflow that could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The GNU Privacy Guard, GnuPG, is a free replacement for the PGP suite of cryptographic software.

description.p: Evgeny Legerov discovered a vulnerability in GnuPG that when certain packets are handled an integer overflow may occur.

impact.p: By sending a specially crafted email to a user running an affected version of GnuPG, a remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running GnuPG.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GnuPG users should upgrade to the latest version:
